questions.question: 1. Which of the following values should be non-zero in a graph ?

explanations.a: Graph with no edges is called an edgeless graph.
explanations.b:
Graph should have at least 1 vertex.
“A graph is defined as a finite set of vertices which might be connected with edges.”
explanations.c: Graph with no cycles is called a tree.

questions.question: 2. How many edges are there in a complete graph ( n = number of vertices) ?

explanations.c: “A complete graph is a graph in which there is an edge between each pair of vertices. So number of edges = nC2  = n*(n-1)/2 .”

questions.question: 3. What is the special feature of a Regular Graph ?

answers.a: All the vertices have the same degree.
answers.b: There is an edge between each pair of vertices.
answers.c: It contains only one vertex with no edges.
answers.d: It contains at least one cycle.

explanations.b: Complete graph is the graph when there are edges between each pair of vertices.
explanations.c: Graph with only vertex and no edges is called a Trivial Graph.
explanations.d: Graph which contains at least one cycle is called a Cyclic Graph.

questions.question:
4. What is the maximum degree a node can have in a simple graph?
(n = number of nodes in graph)

explanations.d: For some node i , the degree of the node is defined as the number of nodes which are connected by a single edge with the node i. In simple Graph there are no self-loop and multiple edges between two nodes. So maximum degree = n-1.

questions.question: 5. An adjacency matrix representation of a graph contains information of :

explanations.d: “An adjacency matrix is a NxN matrix where N = number of nodes in graph. A Cell of the matrix ai,j is 1 if there exists a Edge from node i to node j else ai,j  is 0.”
